well I started taxi driving when I left
University I was in between jobs and I
needed to make extra income but I just
became completely hooked on it I just
found it so interesting spending short
amounts of time with people and learning
about their lives in the taxi do we get
to see quite a cross-section of society
people from all walks of life whether
they are older young rich or poor sober
or high and people in this area and
South Wales do tend to be very friendly
and very talkative as well or you know
by virtue of them spending a short time
in the cab and trusting it as an
anonymous and trusting space they'll
open up about their lives and discuss
quite a lot about their
I was going away from uncertain coming
back and taxi driving to earn money to
travel with and then photographing a lot
when I was abroad as well but mostly
portraits of people
I just became fixated with the idea of
documenting the passengers that I had in
the taxi just to represent Welsh culture
and this moment in time in this region
people get in and when we'd arrived at
the destination if I felt they were that
we had a good rapport I would ask them
if they minded if I would be able to
take their photograph and with that

portrait in the beginning people would
automatically respond by doing a typical

people just to to breathe and just relax
look down the barrel of the camera and
just be I think some people relate to

see the vulnerability and people in

they may even recognize themselves
everyone's been in a taxi they could be

may be quite accurate but they might be

it's not my place to suggest how people
through my work really I mean once I've
